p: P. protopunica Balf. is distributed in different regions of the island, but mainly grows in the central-western part of Socotra, in humid forest regions, in the Haggeher mountains whose slopes are characterized by being made of granite and having a maximum elevation of 1503 m. It also grows on Diksam, the islandâ€™s limestone plateau, which rises precipitously 1520 m above sea level. The total area covered has been calculated to be 1/15 of the total area of Socotra (3796 km 2) [ 27].
